And anytime you get to thinking that it came from you, you know, these self-made men, they say, well, I'm a self-made man, and nobody ever gave me anything. Everything I have, I earned myself. Let me tell you what, that is, as far as I'm concerned, that's an arrogant statement. Because even what the heathen has, God gave to him. He didn't get that on his own. And so I thank God for that. God has blessed me. I don't know how he's, I'm sure he's blessed you as well. But he sees it, but she saw all this. But look in 1 Kings 10, verse 24. After he trots out all this wealth that he has, and she sees all this, and it says, all the earth sought the psalm, and to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart. And they brought every man as present, vessels of silver and vessels of gold and garments, and armor and spices and horses and mules, arrayed year by year. So people are just bringing all this wealth to him. That's amazing.
